object.field: Filled the page_body tag with the page content
Shows internal, system and python information.
Puts links to every lower level page into the CMS page.
Generate a list of the last page updates.
Makes a MySQL dump for a backup
You can make a SQL dump from you DB. Also you can make a install-dump.
A small search engine with rating for your CMS.
With the Module/Plugin Administration you can install/deinstall modules to the DB and you can activate/deactivate this modules in the DB.
Include local sourcecode file into your page.
Includes a local sourcecode file into your cms page and hightlight it.
Edit the look of your CMS
Includes a remote website into your CMS page.
Puts the Stylesheet into the CMS page.

h2. Welcome to the first django powered PyLucid Version!
You can see, it's pre-alpha state ;)
h3. list of last page updates
<lucidTag:page_update_list/>

h1. Ãœberschriften Ãœberschriften werden mit h1. eingeleitet: 
h1. h-1 Ãœberschrift

h2. h-2 Ãœberschrift
Ergibt: h1. h-1 Ãœberschrift h2. h-2 Ãœberschrift (Wichtig ist hierbei, das eine Leerzeile unter der Ãœberschriftzeile bleibt!)
h1. Textformatierung 
Ich bin ein --kleines-- Wort mit ====-Tag
Das wird ein *fettes* Wort mit ====-Tag
Ergibt: Ich bin ein --kleines-- Wort mit ====-Tag Das wird ein *fettes* Wort mit ====-Tag
h1. Links Links werden nach folgendem Schema notiert: 
"LinkText":URL

Beispiele:
----------
http://keinserver.dtl
ftp://keinserver.dtl
mailto:name@beispiel.dtl
http://www.python-forum.de
oder besser: "Das deutsche Python-Forum":http://www.python-forum.de
Das wird auch ein "Link":?#unten
Ein interner PyLucid Link zur Seite [[BeispielSeitenName]]!
To make no link use instand of ":" the ==:==
To make no link you can put the Link into a pre Area: 
==
==No link with a pre area: http://domain.tld==
==
Also you can use a unicode escape sequenz, so thar tinytextile can't find a link. example http*==:==*//domain.tld Ergibt: http://keinserver.dtl ftp://keinserver.dtl mailto:name@beispiel.dtl http://www.python-forum.de oder besser: "Das deutsche Python-Forum":http://www.python-forum.de Das wird auch ein "Link":?#unten Ein interner PyLucid Link zur Seite [[BeispielSeitenName]]! 
No link with a pre area: http://domain.tld
example: http://domain.tld
h1. Listen Normale Listen werden mit einem "*" und nummerierte Liste mit einem "#" eingeleitet. Diese kÃ¶nnen verschachtelt werden. Allerdings sollte man keine normale und nummerierte Listen zusammen mischen. 
* 1. Eintrag in der erste Ebene
** 1. Unterprunkt in der zweiten Ebene
**** 1. Subunterpunkt in der vierter Ebene
**** 2. Subunterpunkt in der vierter Ebene
** 2. Unterprunkt in der zweiten Ebene

Nummerierte Liste:

# Nummer eins
# Nummer zweite
## und so...
## ...weiter...
Ergibt: * 1. Eintrag in der erste Ebene ** 1. Unterprunkt in der zweiten Ebene **** 1. Subunterpunkt in der vierter Ebene **** 2. Subunterpunkt in der vierter Ebene ** 2. Unterprunkt in der zweiten Ebene Nummerierte Liste: # Nummer eins # Nummer zweite ## und so... ## ...weiter...
h1. Bilder Ein HTML-img-Tag wird erzeugt, wenn eine Adresse mit einem "!"-Zeichen umschlossen ist. 
!http://images.sourceforge.net/images/project-support.jpg!
!/favicon.ico!
!http://domain.tld/pics/ich werde zu keiner URL weil hier leerzeichen sind.jpg!
Ergibt: !http://images.sourceforge.net/images/project-support.jpg! !/favicon.ico! !http://domain.tld/pics/ich werde zu keiner URL weil hier leerzeichen sind.jpg!
h1. Python SourceCode Einblenden von Python Sourcecode. Interessant in dem Zusammenhang ist ==== ;) Beispiel: --------- == #!/usr/bin/python # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*- """Ein kleines Skript""" print "Hello Word: I love Python!" == Ergibt: #!/usr/bin/python # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*- """Ein kleines Skript""" print "Hello Word: I love Python!"
h1. Escaping In zwei "="-Zeichen eingeschlossener Text wird escaped. Beispiel: --------- ======== Table: Link: txt Input: ======== Es geht aber auch innerhalb eines Fliesstextes: Mit ========txt======== wird kein Link erzeugt.
h1. pre-Formarted-Text In ==
==-Tag eingeschlossener Text wird nicht escaped und nicht formatiert. D.h. tinytextile Markups werden nicht aufgelÃ¶st. HTML-Tags werden aber in pre-Areas vom Browser angezeigt:


Beispiel:
---------

Das ist eine manuell eingeleitete h3-Ãœberschrift

* Dies bleibt normaler Text...
* ...und wird keine Liste

h4. DE Bitte nutzt das "Forum":http://pylucid.org/index.py/Forum/ , die Mailingliste bzw. Feature Requests/Bugs Seite von sourceforge! Wenn du mir eine pers?nliche eMail schreibst, k?nnen die anderen leider nicht einsehen und evtl. ist es auch f?r andere Interessant! h4. EN Please use the "forum":http://pylucid.org/index.py/Forum/ , the mailinglist and Feature Requests/Bugs page at sourceforge! If you write me personally one mail, the other one cannot see. Perhaps would be also interesting for others. h3. Mailinglist * "pylucid-news":https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/pylucid-news - NEWS about new releases (low Traffic) * "pylucid-general":https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/pylucid-general - General discussion about PyLucid.
Subscribe to PyLucid-general
Email:
Browse Archives at groups.google.com
h3. jabber * Look in the PyLucid Channel: ** pylucid@conference.jabjab.de ** pylucid@conference.jabber.org h3. IRC * You can find us in #PyLucid.org on freenode.net, too: h3. support at "sourceforge":http://www.sourceforge.net/projects/pylucid/ * Report "Feature Requests":http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?atid=764840&group_id=146328&func=browse | "Bugs":http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?atid=764837&group_id=146328&func=browse

<lucidFunction:RSS>url</lucidFunction>
If you can't see the RSS-Feed, you must first install and activate the RSS Plugin to see the RSS-Feed: * log in * goto sub menu / Module Administration * install the RSS Plugin * activate it
h2. PyLucid Project-NEWS RSS feed from sourceforge:
<lucidFunction:RSS>http://sourceforge.net/export/rss2_projnews.php?group_id=146328&rss_fulltext=1</lucidFunction>

h2. ==== Plugin With the SourceCode Plugin you can integrate the source code of a local file into your CMS page. Example Tag: 
==PyLucid/modules/auth/login.css==
Note: With the ====-Tag you can directly put highlight source code into your CMS page, look at [[TinyTextileExample]] PyLucid used the Python syntax highlighter "Pygments":http://pygments.pocoo.org/ . It supports an ever-growing range of languages, look at: http://pygments.pocoo.org/docs/lexers/ h3. some Examples: h5. ./PyLucid/modules/auth/login.css: PyLucid/modules/auth/login.css h5. ./PyLucid/buildin_plugins/MySQLdump/menu.js: PyLucid/buildin_plugins/MySQLdump/menu.js h5. ./PyLucid/buildin_plugins/sub_menu/sub_menu_cfg.py: PyLucid/buildin_plugins/sub_menu/sub_menu_cfg.py h2. ====-Tag Use ==...== and PyLucid used Pygments to highlight it. 'ext' is the typical fileextension/alias, please look at: * http://pygments.pocoo.org/docs/lexers/ h3. examples == .xs {font-family:verdana,arial,helvetica,sans-serif;font-size: x-small} .m {font-size: medium} == result: .xs {font-family:verdana,arial,helvetica,sans-serif;font-size: x-small} .m {font-size: medium} Here a "error" example: This is a code with an unknown format! If there exist no Lexer for the given format, PyLucid used the Pygments TextLexer. So you can make ..., where .xy is any externsion. But for all that it is well displayed through Pygments. Is that cool? =;-)

Note: The old default Style is not the right one to start you own design! The CSS/Template a grow up into chaos ;)
----

This is the default page that a site visitor will see if they arrive at your CMS without specifying a particular page.
This specifies what the default text markup parser will be for new pages. You can set it to the name of a plugin markup parser ("textile" and "markdown" are currently available), or "none".
This is the template that will be assigned to new pages when they are created.
This is the stylesheet taht will be assigned to new pages when they are created.
This determines whether new pages are shown or hidden in navigation controls. Check to have pages shown, or leave unchecked to have new pages suppressed.
This determines whether new pages are publicly accessible, or require login. Check to make new pages automatically accessible, or leave un-checked to have new pages require login.

If checked, whenever someone visits your site, rather then seeing the normal requested page, they will instead see the page that is specified in the "Offline Page" config item. If the user is currently logged in then they will see the requested page.
This is the page that a user will see if the "Offline Site" config item is checked.
Specify your preferred date display format (php time format).
Specify your preferred time display format (php time format).
Specify your preferred date + time display format (php time format).
The number of hours difference between your server's time and the time you wish to have displayed (not necessarily offset from GMT).
The number of idle minutes before requiring user to log in again.
The number of rows to display in the editor.
The number of columns to display in the editor.
Use Page Titles for Link Text
If this is checked, then page titles will be used for the text of links generated in menus. If there is no title, then the page name will be used for the link text.
Peer Menu to replace Sub Menu
If this is checked, then when there are no items to display in the "sub menu" then the "sub menu" will be replaced with the "peer menu". This is usually the desired menu behaviour.
HTML placed after the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu After" will be used.
HTML placed before the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu Before" will be used.
HTML placed after each individual menu item
HTML placed before each individual menu item
HTML placed at the end of the menu
HTML placed at the beginning of the menu
HTML placed after the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu After" will be used.
HTML placed before each individual menu item
HTML placed after each individual menu item
HTML placed before the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu Before" will be used.
HTML placed at the beginning of the menu
HTML placed at the end of the menu
Maximum size (in bytes) of an image you can upload
This is the path to where the uploaded images will be stored. Please ensure that this directory exists and is writable by the web user.
HTML placed after the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu After" will be used.
HTML placed before the currently displayed page link - if this is blank then "Main Menu Before" will be used.
HTML placed after each individual menu item
HTML placed at the end of the menu
HTML placed before each individual menu item
HTML placed at the beginning of the menu

tinyTextile help

h1. headlines headlines are introduced with 'h1.': 
h1. h-1 headline

h2. h-2 headline
Result: h1. h-1 headline h2. h-2 headline (Important: one blank line under the headline!)
h1. Text formatting 
I am a --small-- word with <small> tag.
This is a *fat* word with <strong> tag.
Result: I am a --small-- word with ==== tag. This is a *fat* word with ==== tag.
h1. Links Links according in the following pattern: 
"LinkText":URL
examples: 
http://exampledomain.dtl
ftp://exampledomain.dtl
mailto:name@exampledomain.dtl
http://www.python-forum.de
or better: "Das deutsche Python-Forum":http://www.python-forum.de
This is a link, too: "Link":?#unten
Wiki like, internal PyLucid links: [[ExamplePageName]]
Result: http://exampledomain.dtl ftp://exampledomain.dtl mailto:name@exampledomain.dtl http://www.python-forum.de or better: "Das deutsche Python-Forum":http://www.python-forum.de This is a link, too: "Link":?#unten Wiki like, internal PyLucid links: [[ExamplePageName]]
h1. List You can make ==
    == liste with "*" and ==
      == list with "#". Note: You can't mixed this list types ;) examples: 
      normal list:
* Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
** consectetuer adipiscing elit
**** sed diam nonummy nibh
**** euismod tincidunt ut laoreet
** dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.

numbered list:
# Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
## consectetuer adipiscing elit
#### sed diam nonummy nibh
#### euismod tincidunt ut laoreet
## dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.
      Result: normal list: * Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet ** consectetuer adipiscing elit **** sed diam nonummy nibh **** euismod tincidunt ut laoreet ** dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. numbered list: # Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet ## consectetuer adipiscing elit #### sed diam nonummy nibh #### euismod tincidunt ut laoreet ## dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat.
      h1. Bilder Ein HTML-img-Tag wird erzeugt, wenn eine Adresse mit einem "!"-Zeichen umschlossen ist. 
      !http://images.sourceforge.net/images/project-support.jpg!
!/favicon.ico!
!http://domain.tld/pics/ich werde zu keiner URL weil hier leerzeichen sind.jpg!
      Result: !http://images.sourceforge.net/images/project-support.jpg! !/favicon.ico! !http://domain.tld/pics/ich werde zu keiner URL weil hier leerzeichen sind.jpg!
      h1. Embed Python SourceCode Put sourcecode between ==== tag. Note: The start and end tag must be located alone in a line! example: == #!/usr/bin/python # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*- """Ein kleines Skript""" print "Hello Word: I love Python!" == Result: #!/usr/bin/python # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*- """Ein kleines Skript""" print "Hello Word: I love Python!"
      h1. Embed source code generally With the ==== Tag you can highlight everything, which offers Pygments. 'ext' is the file extension. examples: == body { color: black; } == Result: body { color: black; }
      h1. Escaping Text inner two "="-chars would be escaped. example: -------- ======== Table: Link: txt Input: ======== It goes also within a flow text: Here ist no Link: ========txt======== nice?
      h1. pre-Formarted-Text You can use the ==
      == tag. tinyTextile ingnore the Markup in the area.


      Example:
---------

      Manuelly h3 headline with html tags

* ...textile list

PyLucid JS-MD5-LogIn - step 1

<fieldset><legend>page admin</legend>
* "select page to edit":%(commandURLprefix)s/pageadmin/select_edit_page --(all pages available!)-- * "select page to delete":%(commandURLprefix)s/pageadmin/select_del_page --(a select box, not delete the current page.)-- * "sequencing the pages":%(commandURLprefix)s/pageadmin/sequencing --(change the page order)--
</fieldset>
<fieldset><legend>edit look</legend>
* "edit stylesheets":%(commandURLprefix)s/edit_look/stylesheet * "edit templates":%(commandURLprefix)s/edit_look/template * "edit internal page":%(commandURLprefix)s/edit_look/internal_page
</fieldset>

* "manage user":%(commandURLprefix)s/userhandling/manage_user
</fieldset>

* "DB dump":%(commandURLprefix)s/MySQLdump/menu

</fieldset>

Info:

  • install - register a Module/Plugin in the Database
  • deinstall - All tables, stylesheets and internal pages where delete in the DB.
  • activate - enable the Module/Plugin for the CMS
  • deactivate - disable the Module/Plugin

Node:

  • You may not delete internal jinja tags, like: '{{ name }}'
  • Normal percent sign must be quoted: '%' -> '%%'
  • Markup doesn't work with every page, don't change it.
